OM_Astarion_COM.synopsis: Dialog with the Gur Leader after you defeated Cazador
OM_Astarion_COM.how_to_trigger: Origin Debug Book (Ctrl+Shift+7)Astarion - Origin Moments - Gur Follow-upWalk towards the Gur Leader

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM.synopsis: Dialog with the Gur Leader after you defeated Cazador
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM.how_to_trigger: Origin Debug Book (Ctrl+Shift+7)Astarion - Origin Moments - Gur Follow-upWalk towards the Gur Leader

OM_Astarion_COM_19.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_19.text: Spawn? I am the Vampire Ascendant, Gur. And I thought I was done with your wretched little tribe.
OM_Astarion_COM_19.context: NodeContext: With an air of arrogance

OM_Astarion_COM_61.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_61.text: We're not done. Not even close.

OM_Astarion_COM_74.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_74.text: My name's Ulma, my people are monster hunters. Those of us that remain, that is.
OM_Astarion_COM_74.context: NodeContext: Introducing yourself to Astarion's Companions

OM_Astarion_COM_51.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_51.text: Your companion attacked us in the night and stole our children. Then his master decimated what was left of the tribe.

OM_Astarion_COM_78.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_78.text: You can't blame a spawn for the sins of his master. Any good monster hunter should know that.
OM_Astarion_COM_78.context: NodeContext: With an air of arrogance

OM_Astarion_COM_63.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_63.text: I had no choice. As you 'monster hunters' well know.

OM_Astarion_COM_103.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_103.text: True. So imagine my surprise when I heard you'd fled. Heard you were a rogue spawn, free from Cazador's control.

OM_Astarion_COM_65.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_65.text: We searched half the Sword Coast for you, hoping you could help us destroy him, only to track you right back here.

OM_Astarion_COM_53.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_53.text: And what do we find when we arrive?
OM_Astarion_COM_53.context: NodeContext: This line could be followed by an aggressive line ("one blood-sucking beast replaced with another") or an impressed line ("you killed not only Cazador, but also his wretched creations.") so it needs to be tonally neutral

OM_Astarion_COM_25.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_25.text: One blood-sucking beast replaced with another. Our children sacrificed to birth a monster.

OM_Astarion_COM_87.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_87.text: You're - the Gur tribe? I thought I was done with you people.
OM_Astarion_COM_87.context: NodeContext: Unexpected ghost from your past

OM_Astarion_COM_59.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_59.text: You killed one vampire, but released seven thousand of his spawn? Have you lost all sense?

OM_Astarion_COM_47.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_47.text: They were innocents. To kill them would have been an even greater crime.

OM_Astarion_COM_73.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_73.text: But if you do decide to go hunting them, know they include your children.

OM_Astarion_COM_91.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_91.text: That depends on how you define 'survived', really, but they are free. They're making their way into the Underdark as we speak.

OM_Astarion_COM_28.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_28.text: And our children? What of their fate?

OM_Astarion_COM_81.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_81.text: Cazador turned everyone we brought him into spawn. I can only assume your children were somewhere in those wretched cells.

OM_Astarion_COM_30.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_30.text: You'll find them in the Underdark, although you may not like what you find.

OM_Astarion_COM_40.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_40.text: This is... difficult news. We will need to decide what it means.

OM_Astarion_COM_22.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_22.text: Thank you for what you have done - slaying Cazador was a great justice. As for the rest... well, time will tell.

OM_Astarion_COM_62.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_62.text: I had hoped to avoid this path. I had hoped you would choose the better road.

OM_Astarion_COM_23.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_23.text: A fool I was, to ever hope a beast like you could be saved.

OM_Astarion_COM_36.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_36.text: Oh please, there's no need for such language. I promised you Cazador's death and I more than delivered.

OM_Astarion_COM_71.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_71.text: I even killed a few thousand spawn while I was at it - you should be thanking me for saving you the trouble.

OM_Astarion_COM_101.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_101.text: We don't have to fight. We can work together.

OM_Astarion_COM_54.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_54.text: No, there's no working with the likes of them. Look at the hate in their eyes.

OM_Astarion_COM_48.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_48.text: I need Astarion strong to save the city. This is the lesser evil, I promise.

OM_Astarion_COM_70.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_70.text: There is no greater or lesser, there is only evil. And it stands before me.

OM_Astarion_COM_69.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_69.text: Walk away, Ulma. Your tribe doesn't need to die here.

OM_Astarion_COM_6.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_6.text: Oh I don't know - this might be the perfect place for them to die.

OM_Astarion_COM_12.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_12.text: Look at the hate in their eyes. They won't ever stop hunting me.

OM_Astarion_COM_37.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_37.text: We gave you a choice and you chose power. As your kind always does.

OM_Astarion_COM_44.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_44.text: But I still have hope for you - that you will make a better choice.

OM_Astarion_COM_89.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_89.text: Will you stand against evil. Will you help us destroy this monster?

OM_Astarion_COM_75.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_75.text: Then you are as much a monster as he.

OM_Astarion_COM_8.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_8.text: I can't. There has to be another way.

OM_Astarion_COM_33.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_33.text: My dear, I wouldn't want it any other way.

OM_Astarion_COM_27.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_27.context: CinematicNodeContext: Over her shoulder, to the other hunters standing behind her.

OM_Astarion_COM_32.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_32.text: You're right, Astarion has to be stopped.

OM_Astarion_COM_5.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_5.text: What? You treacherous little shit - I'll kill you all!

OM_Astarion_COM_95.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_95.text: Please, there's no need for such language. You wanted Cazador dead and now he is.

OM_Astarion_COM_88.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_88.text: Cazador is destroyed and his plans ruined. I was not sure you could do it.

OM_Astarion_COM_39.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_39.text: I - I'm sorry. We were too late. Cazador had already turned them.

OM_Astarion_COM_66.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_66.text: You'll find them sealed in the cells below the palace. Although you might not like what you find.

OM_Astarion_COM_94.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_94.text: That being said, slaying Cazador was a great justice. You have our thanks, now and forever.

OM_Astarion_COM_41.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_41.text: I - I don't know for sure, but Cazador turned everyone we brought him. I can only assume that included your children.

OM_Astarion_COM_102.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_102.text: You'll probably find them in the cells below the palace. Although you won't like what you find.

OM_Astarion_COM_100.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_100.text: You killed not only Cazador, but also his wretched creations. I expected less.

OM_Astarion_COM_34.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_34.text: So I can see from all your heavily-armed friends. You didn't think I could resist completing the ritual, did you?

OM_Astarion_COM_21.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_21.text: I admit, I had my doubts.

OM_Astarion_COM_92.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_92.text: But where are our children? What of their fate?

OM_Astarion_COM_98.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_98.text: We were too late. Cazador killed them.

OM_Astarion_COM_57.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_57.text: A monster. A truly wretched monster.

OM_Astarion_COM_90.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_90.text: But thanks to you, a monster that will never rear its head again. You have our thanks.

OM_Astarion_COM_97.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_97.text: You are free - never again will you be hunted by my people.

OM_Astarion_COM_60.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_60.text: Thank you. And for what it's worth - I'm sorry. I wish I could return the ones taken from you.

OM_Astarion_COM_96.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_96.text: You gave them peace. There was nothing more we could ask of you.

OM_Astarion_COM_7.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_7.text: You lie to cover your sins? To blame the vampire for your choices?

OM_Astarion_COM_79.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_79.text: And worse, you thought we would not know? You are hardly better than the beast you slew.

OM_Astarion_COM_84.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_84.text: But we did slay him, so... how about we call it even?

OM_Astarion_COM_56.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_56.text: However twisted, there is a logic there... Very well.

OM_Astarion_COM_42.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_42.text: They died as vampire spawn. It was the only mercy we could give them.

OM_Astarion_COM_0.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_0.text: They likely died as vampire spawn. Which is probably a mercy, honestly.

OM_Astarion_COM_43.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_43.text: Killing children makes for a strange kind of mercy. Although given what they'd become...

OM_Astarion_COM_15.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_15.text: Believe me when I say it was for the best. The pain from the hunger alone - there's nothing like it.

OM_Astarion_COM_77.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_77.text: Mercy? They were our children - mercy would have been giving us a chance to say goodbye. To decide their fate ourselves.

OM_Astarion_COM_58.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_58.text: You think that's what you wanted, but you don't know the hunger. You don't know what it turns us into.

OM_Astarion_COM_9.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_9.text: And you don't know the scar you've left in our tribe, spawn.

OM_Astarion_COM_24.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_24.text: But you have rid this land of your old master, so... consider things settled between us.

OM_Astarion_COM_35.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_35.text: We will not hunt you, but you will never be welcome around our fire.

OM_Astarion_COM_11.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_11.text: Oh, I wasn't holding out for an invitation.

OM_Astarion_COM_76.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_76.text: So when you destroyed the spawn, you killed them too?

OM_Astarion_COM_85.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_85.text: They died long before we arrived. Trust me, they were not the children you knew.

OM_Astarion_COM_13.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_13.text: Perhaps, but the choice should still have been ours. You have taken them from us twice now.

OM_Astarion_COM_52.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_52.text: I have. I've stolen your last chance to see them, and I'd do it again in a heartbeat.

OM_Astarion_COM_82.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_82.text: Because anything else would mean sending you down into the dark. It'd mean showing you the hunger in your babes' eyes and leaving you with that terrible, final decision.

OM_Astarion_COM_16.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_16.text: I've visited enough pain on your people. The least I could do was spare you that.

OM_Astarion_COM_2.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_2.text: Perhaps there was something to that. A kindness I would not have credited you with.

OM_Astarion_COM_31.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_31.text: Well that's backhanded as compliments come. Though I'll take it if it means you're done trying to kill me.

OM_Astarion_COM_72.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_72.text: I never dreamt a spawn could find redemption, but - yes. You will never be hunted again.

OM_Astarion_COM_38.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_38.text: As for you, you have my people's thanks. I know you face trials ahead - we will stand with you as best we can.

OM_Astarion_COM_1.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_COM_1.text: Until then, go in peace. And thank you.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_5.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_5.text: You killed not only Cazador, but also his wretched creations. I expected less.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_80.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_80.text: So I can see from all your heavily-armed friends. You didn't think I could resist completing the ritual, did you?

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_64.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_64.text: I admit, I had my doubts. I did not want to face a new, powerful vampire unarmed. I am pleased to be wrong.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_42.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_42.text: Thank you. And for what it's worth - I'm sorry. I wish I could return the ones I took from you.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_24.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_24.text: I had hoped to avoid this path. I had hoped you would choose the better road.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_58.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_58.text: A fool I was, to ever hope a beast like you could be saved.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_33.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_33.text: Oh please, there's no need for such language. I promised you Cazador's death and I more than delivered.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_50.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_50.text: Cazador is destroyed and his plans ruined. I was not sure you could do it.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_79.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_79.text: Cazador may be gone, but there are still thousands of vampire spawn down there.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_70.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_70.text: An unexpected wrinkle, but we shall tend to them. You have done enough.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_36.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_36.text: Cazador may be gone, but there are still thousands of vampire spawn down there. Including your children.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_91.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_91.text: Out of my way. I'm in no mood to talk.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_89.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_89.text: Slaying Cazador was a great justice. You have our thanks, now and forever.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_67.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_67.text: You killed one vampire, but released seven thousand of his spawn? Have you lost all sense?

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_63.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_63.text: They were innocents. To kill them would have been an even greater crime.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_13.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_13.text: But if you ever decide to hunt them, know they include your children.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_41.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_41.text: That depends on how you define 'survived', really, but they are free. They're making their way into the Underdark as we speak.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_103.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_103.text: This is... difficult news. We will need to decide what it means.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_72.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_72.text: Perhaps, but innocent or not, they remain dangerous.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_82.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_82.text: Thank you for what you have done - slaying Cazador was a great justice. As for the rest... well, time will tell.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_74.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_74.text: Hold there, vampire. We have business to settle.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_87.speaker: Narrator
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_87.text: *You don't know the woman's name, but you recognise her face. You saw it in the firelight, twisted in rage and grief the night you stole her tribe's children.*

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_52.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_52.text: I am Ulma, of the Gur. You know my people. You helped your master bring us down.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_99.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_99.text: And your children helped me ascend to new power. How fitting.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_34.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_34.text: I'm sorry I took your children, but Cazador's dead now. It's over.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_12.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_12.text: For you, perhaps. Not for us.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_105.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_105.text: We searched for you when we heard you were free, hoping you could help us undo the evil he started.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_14.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_14.text: We tracked you halfway across the Sword Coast, only to finally catch up with you here.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_86.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_86.text: One blood-sucking beast replaced with another. Our children sacrificed to birth a monster.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_38.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_38.text: I had no choice, I was a spawn, following orders.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_49.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_49.text: Once, perhaps. Now you're something else entirely.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_4.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_4.text: If you want to fight, can we just get on with it?

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_95.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_95.text: I did not come here to fight. I'd hoped to talk.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_83.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_83.text: You killed not only Cazador, but also his wretched creations. I admit, I expected less.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_56.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_56.text: For us, destroying evil is a simple choice. We are born to do it - trained to do it.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_96.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_96.text: But to face your kin? To face everything you know and still make that choice. There is nothing simple there.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_26.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_26.text: You didn't think I could do it? I'm hurt.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_35.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_35.text: I never doubted your ability to kill. But your ability to resist temptation? That I doubted.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_16.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_16.text: I feared you would complete the ritual and we would face a new, more powerful foe. I am pleased to be wrong.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_3.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_3.text: Well I expect you'll leave me in peace from now on.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_76.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_76.text: Your sins against us were great. But today, so were your deeds.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_102.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_102.text: You are free - never again will you be hunted by my people.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_9.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_9.text: Thank you, I only want to live in peace.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_30.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_30.text: I fear none of us will see peace yet. There are still trials ahead.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_84.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_84.text: But you have my people's thanks - when it is time for you to face those trials, we will stand with you.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_90.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_90.text: For what it's worth, I'm sorry. I wish I could bring your children back.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_2.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_2.text: You gave them peace. For that, for all you have done, you have our thanks.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_53.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_53.text: I know you face trials ahead. But when it is time, you will not face them alone. We will stand with you as best we can.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_47.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_47.text: We offer no gold, but we do give you a promise.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_40.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_40.text: And I hope I never see any of you again.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_104.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_104.text: I would not be so hasty. You have trials still to face - you may want allies.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_22.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_22.text: If such a time comes, if you need help, we will stand with you.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_66.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_66.text: Until then, go in peace. And thank you.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_51.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_51.text: Get out of my way. I'm in no mood to talk.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_55.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_55.text: Forgive me, I meant no disrespect.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_92.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_92.text: Cazador is destroyed and his plans ruined. I was not sure you could do it.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_20.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_20.text: You should know - Cazador may be dead, but there are still thousands of spawn locked up down there.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_107.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_107.text: I had hoped to avoid this path. I had hoped you would choose the better road.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_10.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_10.text: A fool I was, to ever hope a beast like you could be saved.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_77.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_77.text: Don't you understand? With this power I can save the city!

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_46.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_46.text: And when the city is saved? Can you give up this power? Or do you look for the next battle? The next conquest?

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_11.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_11.text: Perhaps today your intentions are good? Perhaps. But power twists people. Corrupts people. Convinces them to do terrible things for a 'greater good'.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_18.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_18.text: We do not wait for that to happen. We destroy evil here, today!

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_94.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_94.text: I promised I'd kill Cazador. Did I not deliver?

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_108.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_108.text: You think we will see one evil replaced by another? No.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_59.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_59.text: Walk away. Don't sacrifice what's left of your tribe for nothing.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_44.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_44.text: If we turn our backs on evil like you, then my tribe is not worth saving.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_45.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_45.context: NodeContext: Over her shoulder to the warriors behind her - calling them to join her in attacking you

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_1.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_1.text: You're even more of a fool to stand in my way now.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_69.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_69.text: Perhaps. But better a fool than a coward.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_109.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_109.text: You killed one vampire, but released seven thousand of his spawn? Have you lost all sense?

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_19.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_19.text: They were innocent - it would have been more evil to kill them.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_23.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_23.text: Perhaps, but innocent or not, they remain dangerous.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_65.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_65.text: Thank you for what you have done - slaying Cazador was a great justice. As for the rest... well, time will tell.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_112.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_112.text: Yes, I set them free. Including your children - they're spawn too now.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_68.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_68.context: NodeContext: just got the terrible news her tribes children were turned into vampires

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_78.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_78.text: This is... difficult news. We will need to decide what it means.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_15.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_15.text: They're in the Underdark - they'll feed on the monsters down there.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_61.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_61.text: I pray you are right. But if they leave to hunt on the surface, they will get no mercy from us.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_88.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_88.text: So? If you have a problem with it, go deal with it.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_93.speaker: Ulma
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_93.text: Do not fear, they will be dealt with.
